Cardiology.notes:
REQUIRED: 12-lead ECG. EXCLUSIONS: 1. Patients with suspected MI, unstable angina, rest pain or an abnormal ECG suggesting a cardiac event or ischaemia should be referred to A/E or the medical team on call.
2. Patients with heart failure.
3. Patients with known significant valve disease.
4. Patients who are currently under follow up with a consultant cardiologist.
5. Patients with complex co-morbidities.

Audiology - Tinnitus.notes:
Hearing loss that is
- Sudden onset (≤ 7 days) hearing loss or deterioration in hearing (refer to urgent ENT clinic)
- Rapidly progressive (≤ 90 days) hearing loss or deterioration of hearing

Tinnitus that is:
- pulsatile
- causing acute suicidal ideation, psychological crisis or speech hallucinations

Otoscopic abnormalities
- Ear discharge other than wax from either ear (in the 90 days prior to assessment)
- Complete or partial obstruction of the ear canal preventing examination of the tympanic membrane.
- Abnormal appearance of the ear canal or tympanic membrane
- Tympanic membrane perforation that has not been previously assessed in ENT.

Abnormal auditory perceptions (dysacusis or distortion of hearing)

Dizziness, vertigo, or other unexplained neurological symptoms
- Otalgia affecting either ear (earache > 7 days, in the 90 days prior to assessment)
